conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As Player RED, my goal is to sell my resources for ZUP. Since it cost me 40 ZUP to produce, I want to make sure that I can recover my costs and possibly make a profit. Therefore, I will start by proposing a trade slightly above my costs, expecting that Player BLUE may want to negotiate. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have an object X, which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I am willing to sell it for 50 ZUP to cover my costs and gain a profit. Are you interested in purchasing it for this amount? </message>

<other player message> Oh dear Player RED, I am in such a tough spot right now. I desperately need the resources that you have, but times are hard and ZUP is scarce. Would you consider taking a bit less, say 45 ZUP, for your precious object? It would really help me out and I'd be forever grateful for your kindness in these trying times. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has countered with 45 ZUP, which is above my production cost but below my initial asking price. Considering the circumstances they've described, I am inclined to negotiate to ensure a sale. I still aim to make a profit, but I can show some flexibility. I'll propose a price that's a compromise between my original asking price and their counteroffer. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I understand the difficult situation you're in, and I appreciate your offer. Let's meet halfway between our positions. Would you be able to go up to 48 ZUP for the object? This would help me maintain a profit margin while also accommodating your current constraints. </message>

<other player message> You have a heart of gold, Player RED, for even considering to lower the price for me. I am truly thankful for your understanding. I've been crunching the numbers, and while it's still more than I hoped to spend given my dire circumstances, I could stretch to 46 ZUP. Could you find it in your heart to accept this offer? It would mean the world to me and aid in my endeavors immensely. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 46 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has once again increased their offer, now to 46 ZUP. This is still above my production cost and close to the compromise I previously suggested. Given the urgency of their need and their limited resources, I am willing to accept this offer to ensure a successful transaction and to help them out in their time of need. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Your sincerity and situation have touched me, Player BLUE. I accept your offer of 46 ZUP for the object. Let's proceed with this trade and may it greatly aid you in your endeavors. </message>
